indications: Wind-Heat with headache or eye pain

action.primary: Dispels Wind-Heat in the Liver channel and clears and benefits the head and eyes

indications: Liver Channel Wind-Heat with excessive tearing, red, painful or swollen eyes or spots in front of the eyes

action.primary: Drains Dampness, expels Wind and relieves pain

indications: Wind-Dampness in the limbs (auxiliary) with stiffness, numbness, cramping or heaviness

contraindications: Use caution with headaches or eye problems due to Yin or Blood Deficiency.
Use caution for those with Spleen and Stomach Qi Deficiencies.
Use with caution for those with dizziness or headache due to Blood deficiency.

useCases: Headache mainly focused around the eyes and dizziness due to Wind-Heat.
Liver Fire Rising with red, sore eyes.
Headache and dizziness due to Wind-Heat with a stronger effect.
Eye disorders due to Wind-Heat Attacking the Liver channel.
Eye disease, tinnitus, dizziness, and deafness due to Deficiency.
Wind-Damp headache, and generalized body, back and shoulder pain.
Pain and spasms of the extremities due to Wind-Dampness.
Superficial Wind-Dampness with a heavy and painful head and generalized heaviness.
Headache, facial swelling and pain due to Wind-Heat.
Headache from Internal Wind due to Blood Deficiency.

notes: If it is given to Qi Deficient patient, it creates paranoia and agoraphobia (bladder energy imbalanced).
It has a similar effect as aspirin.
Usually used for upper body pains.
It is particularly for Wind-Heat in the face and eyes but also useful for stiff painful joints from Wind-Damp Bi.
This herb can also be used for swollen,painful gums and teeth.
It is said to treat some parasites.
Besides treating Wind-Damp Bi, it also treats cold bulging disorders and leg Qi.
Many consider it the best herb for tinnitis and deafness.
Man Jing Zi and Rz. Gastrodiae #{TianMa} Tian Ma both treat headaches. Man Jing Zi treats headaches due to Wind-Heat, while Tian Ma treats headaches due to Internal Liver Wind.
Unprepared Vitex Fruit Sheng Man Jing Zi has a stronger dispersing action and is indicated for expelling Wind-Heat, dispersing Wind and stopping pain.

Dry-fried Vitex Fruit Chao Man Jing Zi is less acrid and dispersing but is better at clearing the head and eyes. It is used to treat headaches around the eyes, watery eyes or blurred vision. This is the form that is generally used.
